hotspots.label: Long Pointed Beak
hotspots.fact: Pelicans have long, curved beaks specially designed for catching fish in the water. The beak can hold up to 3 gallons of water in a pouch underneath, making it one of the largest beaks of any bird!

hotspots.label: Waterproof Feathers
hotspots.fact: Pelican feathers are covered with a special oil that makes them waterproof. This helps them stay dry and warm even after diving into the ocean to catch fish.

hotspots.label: Strong Feet
hotspots.fact: Pelicans have webbed feet that help them swim and balance on rocks or docks. Their feet act like little paddles to push them through the water efficiently.

hotspots.label: Eye and Head Markings
hotspots.fact: The white and black markings on a pelican's head help it look for fish in the water. Their excellent eyesight helps them spot fish from far away before diving down to catch them.
